evidence: Sutskever completed his PhD under Geoffrey Hinton at the University of Toronto in 2012. His thesis was titled 'Training recurrent neural networks.'
Krizhevsky completed his PhD under Hinton at the University of Toronto around 2012. Together with Sutskever and Hinton, he created AlexNet.
Salakhutdinov earned his PhD from the University of Toronto in 2009 under Geoffrey Hinton, with thesis 'Learning deep generative models.'
Teh completed his PhD under Hinton at the University of Toronto in 2003.
Dahl completed his PhD under Hinton at Toronto in 2015 on 'Deep Learning Approaches to Problems in Speech Recognition, Computational Chemistry and Natural Language Processing.'
Srivastava completed his PhD in 2016 at Toronto, co-advised by Hinton and Salakhutdinov. Co-author of influential Dropout paper.
Kingma's PhD was at University of Amsterdam, but he collaborated extensively with Hinton's group and was influenced by Toronto school approaches.
Goodfellow earned his PhD from Université de Montréal in 2014, supervised by Yoshua Bengio and Aaron Courville. Invented GANs during his PhD.
Courville is a full professor at Université de Montréal and core MILA member. Co-authored the definitive 'Deep Learning' textbook with Bengio and Goodfellow (2016).
Cho did postdoctoral research at MILA with Bengio. Co-inventor of the GRU (Gated Recurrent Unit) architecture with Bengio in 2014.
After his PhD at McGill, Bengio did postdoctoral work at MIT under Michael Jordan, working on sequential learning and statistical methods.
Abbeel was Andrew Ng's first PhD student at Stanford. He is now a professor at UC Berkeley and co-founder of Covariant.
Le was advised by Andrew Ng at Stanford before joining Google Brain.
Karpathy completed his PhD at Stanford under Fei-Fei Li, focusing on the intersection of computer vision and natural language. Co-taught CS231n with Li.
Gebru earned her PhD from Stanford in 2017 under Fei-Fei Li, working on computer vision and later AI ethics.
Russakovsky completed her PhD under Fei-Fei Li at Stanford, contributing significantly to ImageNet.
Silver did his PhD at University of Alberta under Richard Sutton, the 'father of reinforcement learning.' Silver later led AlphaGo development at DeepMind.
OpenAI was founded in December 2015 by Sam Altman, Elon Musk, Greg Brockman, Ilya Sutskever, and others.
Musk was a co-founder and early funder of OpenAI. He departed the board in February 2018.
Brockman left his position as CTO of Stripe to co-found OpenAI and serve as its President.
Sutskever was recruited from Google Brain to co-found OpenAI and serve as Chief Scientist. Departed May 2024.
Schulman was a co-founder of OpenAI, leading reinforcement learning research. Creator of PPO algorithm.
Zaremba was among the original co-founders of OpenAI, focusing on robotics and language model research.
Karpathy was a founding member of OpenAI in 2015, later leaving for Tesla (2017).
Kingma was listed among the original OpenAI team, known for inventing the Adam optimizer and VAEs.
Dario Amodei co-founded Anthropic in 2021 after leaving his role as VP of Research at OpenAI.
Daniela Amodei co-founded Anthropic with her brother Dario, serving as President.
Kaplan was a co-founder of Anthropic, serving as Chief Science Officer. Known for scaling laws research.
Brown was a co-founder of Anthropic. He was lead author on the GPT-3 paper while at OpenAI.
Clark was a co-founder of Anthropic, serving as Head of Policy.
McCandlish was a co-founder of Anthropic, known for work on scaling laws.
Olah was a co-founder of Anthropic, focusing on interpretability research. Founder of Distill.pub.
Hassabis co-founded DeepMind in London in 2010 along with Shane Legg and Mustafa Suleyman.
Legg was a co-founder of DeepMind, serving as Chief AGI Scientist.
Suleyman was a co-founder of DeepMind. Later left to found Inflection AI.
Dean co-founded Google Brain in 2011 along with Andrew Ng and Greg Corrado.
Ng co-founded Google Brain with Jeff Dean and Greg Corrado. The famous 'cat neuron' experiment emerged from this work.
Corrado was a co-founder of Google Brain with Dean and Ng.
LeCun founded Facebook AI Research (FAIR) in December 2013 and continues to lead it as Chief AI Scientist at Meta.
Mensch co-founded Mistral AI in April 2023 with Guillaume Lample and Timothée Lacroix.
Lample left Meta FAIR to co-found Mistral AI, serving as Chief Scientist.
Lacroix left Meta to co-found Mistral AI, serving as CTO.
Musk announced the founding of xAI in July 2023, recruiting researchers from DeepMind and Google.
Babuschkin was a co-founder and Chief Engineer of xAI, recruited from DeepMind. Led Grok development.
Gomez co-founded Cohere in 2019, serving as CEO. He was the youngest author on the Transformer paper.
Zhang co-founded Cohere with Gomez and Nick Frosst.
Frosst co-founded Cohere after working with Geoffrey Hinton at Google Brain on capsule networks.
Delangue co-founded Hugging Face in 2016, serving as CEO.
Chaumond co-founded Hugging Face, serving as CTO.
Wolf co-founded Hugging Face, serving as Chief Science Officer. Created the Transformers library.
Jones co-founded Sakana AI in Tokyo with David Ha. Jones was a co-author of the Transformer paper.
Ha co-founded Sakana AI with Llion Jones. Previously at Google Brain, known for creative AI research.
Bengio founded MILA (originally LISA lab) and has led it for decades, building it into the largest academic AI research institute in the world.
Hinton co-founded the Vector Institute in 2017 to anchor Toronto's AI ecosystem.
Fei-Fei Li co-founded Stanford HAI (Human-Centered AI Institute) and serves as co-director.
Gebru founded the DAIR Institute after her departure from Google to pursue independent AI ethics research.
Sutskever co-founded Safe Superintelligence Inc. (SSI) in June 2024 after departing OpenAI.
Vaswani was first author on 'Attention Is All You Need', the Transformer paper that revolutionized AI.
Shazeer was co-author of the Transformer paper. All 8 authors listed as equal contributors.
Kaiser was co-author of the Transformer paper at Google Brain.
Gomez was co-author of the Transformer paper (was an intern at Google at the time). Youngest author on the paper.
Jones was co-author of the Transformer paper at Google.
Uszkoreit was co-author of the Transformer paper at Google.
Parmar was co-author of the Transformer paper at Google.
Polosukhin was co-author of the Transformer paper while at Google.
Krizhevsky was first author on the AlexNet paper that won ImageNet 2012.
Sutskever was co-author of AlexNet with Krizhevsky and Hinton.
Hinton was co-author of AlexNet with his students Krizhevsky and Sutskever.
Goodfellow was primary author on the GAN paper, introducing Generative Adversarial Networks.
Bengio co-authored the GAN paper with his PhD student Goodfellow.
Kingma was first author on the Adam optimizer paper.
Ba co-authored the Adam optimizer paper with Kingma.
Tom Brown was lead author on 'Language Models are Few-Shot Learners' (GPT-3), one of the most influential AI papers.
Radford was primary author on the GPT-1 paper at OpenAI.
Radford was primary author on the GPT-2 paper.
Radford was a primary author on CLIP at OpenAI.
Ramesh was lead author on the DALL-E papers.
Touvron was lead author on the LLaMA paper at Meta.
Lample co-authored the LLaMA paper at Meta.
Silver led the AlphaGo project at DeepMind.
Hassabis led the AlphaGo project at DeepMind.
Jumper led the AlphaFold2 development, solving protein structure prediction.
Hassabis co-led AlphaFold with Jumper. Both won Nobel Prize in Chemistry 2024.
Rombach was lead inventor of Latent Diffusion Models and Stable Diffusion at LMU Munich.
Blattmann co-invented Stable Diffusion with Rombach.
Goodfellow co-authored the Deep Learning textbook with Bengio and Courville.
Bengio co-authored the Deep Learning textbook.
Courville co-authored the Deep Learning textbook.
Sutton co-authored the foundational RL textbook with Barto.
Wolf originally created the Hugging Face Transformers library.
Olah co-founded Distill.pub for clear ML explanations.
Dario Amodei left his role as VP of Research at OpenAI in late 2020/early 2021 to co-found Anthropic, reportedly due to disagreements about safety and commercialization.
Daniela Amodei left OpenAI's safety and policy team to co-found Anthropic with her brother.
Brown, lead author of GPT-3, left OpenAI to co-found Anthropic.
Sutskever departed OpenAI in May 2024 to found Safe Superintelligence Inc. He was involved in the November 2023 board crisis.
Leike resigned from OpenAI in May 2024, publicly stating that safety concerns were not being adequately prioritized.
Murati departed as CTO in September 2024, along with other senior executives.
Lample left Meta FAIR to co-found Mistral AI in April 2023.
Lacroix left Meta to co-found Mistral AI with Lample and Mensch.
Mensch left Google DeepMind to co-found Mistral AI.
Suleyman left DeepMind/Google to found Inflection AI in 2022.
Hinton resigned from Google in May 2023 to speak freely about AI risks.
Hinton, Bengio, and LeCun are known as the 'Godfathers of AI' and have collaborated and influenced each other over decades. They shared the 2018 Turing Award.
Hinton and LeCun have been close collaborators since the 1980s, both pioneering neural network approaches during AI winters.
Bengio and LeCun collaborated on convolutional networks and have maintained close ties.
Hassabis and Silver led the AlphaGo project together, achieving the historic victory over Lee Sedol in 2016.
Huang implemented key parts of AlphaGo and physically played the moves in the match against Lee Sedol.
Hassabis and Jumper led the AlphaFold project, winning the Nobel Prize in Chemistry in 2024.
Dean and Ng worked together to establish Google Brain, including the famous 'cat neuron' experiment.
Bengio and Precup both lead research at MILA.
Dario and Daniela Amodei are siblings who co-founded Anthropic together.
Yoshua and Samy Bengio are brothers, both prominent in ML research.
Hinton joined Google Brain in 2013 after Google acquired DNNresearch. He resigned in May 2023.
Radford has been a research scientist at OpenAI since its early days. Lead author on GPT-1, GPT-2, CLIP.
Murati served as CTO of OpenAI from 2018 to September 2024.
Leike led OpenAI's superalignment team until departing in May 2024.
Kaiser joined OpenAI from Google Brain in June 2021.
Pineau is VP of AI Research at Meta.
Touvron is a research scientist at Meta FAIR in Paris, lead researcher on LLaMA models.
Silver is a principal research scientist at DeepMind.
Jumper is a director at DeepMind, leading the AlphaFold team.
Vinyals is VP of Research at DeepMind, co-leading Gemini development.
Shazeer worked at Google from 2000-2021, co-authoring the Transformer paper.
Mitchell joined Hugging Face as Chief AI Ethics Scientist after departing Google.
Fei-Fei Li is Professor at Stanford and co-director of Stanford HAI.
Hinton has been at University of Toronto since 1987, making it the birthplace of the 'Toronto School' of deep learning.
Bengio has been at Université de Montréal since 1993, founding MILA.
Sutton has been at University of Alberta since 2003.
Michael Jordan is Professor at UC Berkeley.
Abbeel is Professor at UC Berkeley and BAIR director.
Salakhutdinov is Professor at Carnegie Mellon.
LeCun is Silver Professor at NYU while also serving as Chief AI Scientist at Meta.
Geoffrey Hinton was born in London, England on December 6, 1947.
Demis Hassabis was born in London, England on July 27, 1976.
Yann LeCun was born in Paris, France in 1960.
Yoshua Bengio was born in Paris, France on March 5, 1964.
Bengio co-founded ICLR (International Conference on Learning Representations) with Yann LeCun.
LeCun co-founded ICLR with Yoshua Bengio.
OpenAI created and launched ChatGPT in November 2022.
Anthropic developed and launched Claude.
Google DeepMind created Gemini, their flagship LLM.
Meta AI created and released LLaMA.
xAI created Grok chatbot.
Mistral AI created Mistral 7B.
Stability AI commercialized and scaled Stable Diffusion (based on LMU Munich research).
Mikolov was lead author on 'Efficient Estimation of Word Representations in Vector Space' (Word2Vec), which introduced Skip-gram and CBOW models.
Devlin was lead author on 'BERT: Pre-training of Deep Bidirectional Transformers for Language Understanding', which revolutionized NLP.
Welling co-authored 'Auto-Encoding Variational Bayes' with Kingma, introducing VAEs.
Kingma was first author on the VAE paper, developed during his PhD at University of Amsterdam under Max Welling.
Schulman was lead author on 'Proximal Policy Optimization Algorithms', the algorithm fundamental to RLHF used in ChatGPT.
Schulman was lead author on 'Trust Region Policy Optimization', which introduced trust region methods to deep RL.
Suleyman co-founded Inflection AI in 2022 after leaving DeepMind. Reid Hoffman was co-founder.
Shazeer left Google to co-found Character.AI with Daniel De Freitas in 2021.
Shazeer returned to Google in 2024 as VP of Engineering co-leading Gemini after Google's acquisition deal with Character.AI.
Suleyman and most of Inflection's team joined Microsoft in March 2024. Suleyman became EVP and CEO of Microsoft AI.
Anthropic released Claude 3 family (Haiku, Sonnet, Opus) in March 2024.
Meta AI released LLaMA 3 in April 2024 with 8B and 70B parameter variants.
Touvron continued to lead LLaMA development for the third generation release.
Mikolov worked at Google where he developed Word2Vec (2013).
Mikolov joined Facebook AI Research after Google, working on fastText and other NLP projects.
Devlin developed BERT at Google AI and continues to work at Google DeepMind.
Kingma did his PhD at University of Amsterdam under Max Welling, where they co-invented VAEs.
OpenAI released GPT-4o ('Omni') on May 13, 2024 as their flagship multimodal model.
OpenAI released GPT-4o mini on July 18, 2024 as a cost-efficient alternative.
OpenAI released o1-preview on September 12, 2024, followed by full o1 in December 2024.
OpenAI announced o3 in December 2024, with o3-mini released January 31, 2025 and full o3 in April 2025.
OpenAI released GPT-4.5 (codenamed Orion) on February 27, 2025 as a research preview.
Anthropic released Claude 3.5 Sonnet on June 20, 2024.
Anthropic released Claude 4 (Opus 4 and Sonnet 4) on May 22, 2025.
Anthropic released Claude 4.5 Sonnet on September 29, 2025, with Opus 4.5 following in November 2025.
Google DeepMind released Gemini 1.5 Pro in early 2024 with up to 1M token context.
Google DeepMind released Gemini 2.0 Flash (experimental) in December 2024, with GA in February 2025.
Google DeepMind released Gemini 2.5 Flash and Pro stable versions on June 17, 2025.
Meta released LLaMA 3.1 on July 23, 2024, including the 405B parameter model.
Meta released LLaMA 3.2 on September 25, 2024, adding multimodal capabilities.
Meta released LLaMA 3.3 on December 6, 2024 as an efficient 70B model.
Meta released LLaMA 4 (Scout and Maverick) on April 5, 2025.
Touvron continued as lead researcher on LLaMA development through the 3.1 release.
Touvron led LLaMA 3.2 development, the first multimodal LLaMA release.
Mistral AI released Mixtral 8x22B on April 17, 2024.
Mistral AI released Pixtral 12B on September 11, 2024, followed by Pixtral Large in November 2024.
Mistral AI released Mistral Large 3 and Ministral 3 on December 2, 2025.
xAI released Grok 2 in August 2024 with multimodal capabilities and image generation.
xAI released Grok 3 on February 17, 2025, trained on Colossus with 200K H100 GPUs.
Cohere released Command R+ in April 2024 as their flagship enterprise model.
Cohere released Command A in March 2025 with 111B parameters and 256K context.
Amazon released the Nova foundation model family in December 2024 for AWS Bedrock.
Amazon released Nova Premier in Q1 2025 as their top-tier reasoning model.
Mustafa Suleyman joined Microsoft as EVP and CEO of Microsoft AI in March 2024 after Inflection acquisition.
GPT-4o is built on the GPT-4 architecture with added multimodal capabilities.
Claude 3.5 Sonnet is an improved version of the Claude 3 model family.
Claude 4 is the successor to the Claude 3 model family.
Gemini 2.0 is the successor to the original Gemini model.
LLaMA 3.1 is a major update to the LLaMA 3 model family.
LLaMA 4 is the successor to the LLaMA 3 model family.
Grok 3 is the successor to the original Grok model, trained with 10x more compute.
